content.text:
# Grzymisław (steward)

Grzymisław (1153/1158 – 1207/1209) was a nobleman from the Samboride dynasty, who was a steward of Świecie and Lubiszewo within the Duchy of Eastern Pomerania.
Biography
He came from the Samboride dynasty and was born between 1153 and 1158. He was a steward of Świecie and Lubiszewo within the Duchy of Eastern Pomerania, under the rule of the Kingdom of Poland. The first record of his name comes from the year 11 November 1198. Originally, the seat of his part of the duchy was located in Starogard Gdański, but later he moved it to Świecie. After 1195, he had married Dobrosława, with whom he had daughters, one of which possibly could be Zwinisława, wife of Mestwin I. Grzymisław died between 1207 and 1209. He was succeeded by Mestwin I.
